FuncDef:
The evpn binding vpn-instance command binds a PE's EVPL instance to an EVPN instance.
The undo evpn binding vpn-instance command removes the binding relationship between a PE's EVPL instance to an EVPN instance.
By default, a PE's EVPL instance without being bound to any EVPN instance.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an EVPN instance to be bound to an EVPL instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In VPWS EVPN scenarios, the user-side AC interface maps to an EVPL instance. The EVPL instance on a PE is bound to an EVPN instance and the EVPL instance is then bound to the user-side AC interface and network-side MPLS/SR tunnel interface to allow communication between the user-side AC interface and network-side MPLS/SR tunnel interface.
